Well I don't know much about anything, but I sure liked this film. In short, it was creative, humorous, simple, and heartwarming.
I could tell that the people working behind-the-scenes really cared about their film. They may not be professionals by trade or career choice (though quite a few of them are), they still had a vivacity to their work that emanated from their enjoyment of making a film. I'd even say some shades of Hitchcock...this is clearly better than MMM, which is seen as a guilty pleasure by some if not most Woody fans.
